TopicTitle: How to do planetary transfers with Kerbal engineer?

Articles.Content:
I've been using Kerbal Engineer for a while and I've got no idea how to use it to transfer to other planets. Is there a tutorial?

The few times I've been to Duna or EVE I just leave kerbins SOI then change orbit like when I do an orbital rendezvous. While that works, it's probably not the best way.
From what I can tell KER cannot do interplanetary transfers on it's own. You will need something like Alexmoon's launch windows planner. http://alexmoon.github.io/ksp/

KER is primarily a tool for vehicle analysis--mission planning decisions like launch windows and transfers are left up to you. (That's actually one of the reasons I prefer KER to Mechjeb for this purpose.) For transfer window alerts, I use Kerbal Alarm Clock.
I've also found OLEX's Guide and Calculator incredibly useful - http://ksp.olex.biz.

Here's the in-game port of the same calculator:

http://www.curse.com/ksp-mods/kerbal/224116-transfer-window-planner

For you, it looks like a phase angle calculator might be best, at least as far as i can tell.

Hereitis

this is the nicest one I've found, hope it's helpful!

Thanks for all the replys. I've only been using KERBIN for a while and most of its features seem pretty easy to understand except for the RND page.

I've got no idea what a phase angle or intercept angle is. If the Rendezvous page isn't for planetary transfers, what is it for?

I've done loads of orbital rendezvous and docking and never needed any of the functions that KER is showing.
